description.message: Add customized infinite scrolling to websites and auto load the next page. (Beta)

install_dialog_title.message: Thank You for Adding Infy Scroll

install_dialog_know.message: Before getting started, there's a few things you should know...

install_dialog_list_1.message: Infy is currently ?. It might contain some bugs and it might not work on every website you try it on.

install_dialog_list_2.message: Infy is already set to auto-activate on many websites. If you don't want it to, you can change the Activation Mode under the Database Options.

install_dialog_toolbar.message: Also, if you don't see Infy's Icon in your Browser's Toolbar, click the "Puzzle Piece Icon" from your Toolbar so you can pin it.

install_dialog_help.message: Lastly, I want you to be 100% happy with Infy! If something isn't working right, please feel free to open an issue on GitHub:

version_dialog_description.message: Thank you for using Infy! I really hope you like this new version. It brings the new AJAX Append Mode and a brand new Dark Mode. Here's what's new:

version_dialog_list_1.message: New AJAX Append Mode and SPA Option (Experimental)

version_dialog_list_2.message: New Dark Mode Theme, adjustable in Options (Experimental)

version_dialog_list_4.message: New Add and Edit Save features in Options

version_dialog_list_6.message: New My Stats feature in Options (Optional)

version_dialog_list_7.message: Path inputs are now textareas and can auto-detect the type (Selector or XPath)

version_dialog_list_8.message: And many more changes and issues fixed on GitHub

version_dialog_footer.message: If you encounter any issues or bugs with this release, please feel free to open an issue on GitHub. Thank you

iframes_not_supported_error.message: Infy can't append Iframes on this website, most likely because this website set its 'X-Frame-Options' to 'deny'. Try using

next_document_error.message: Infy had trouble getting the next page's document. This might be because the server is down or due to CORS. For assistance, please report this issue on GitHub.

insertion_point_before.message: derived from the insert before path

insertion_point_new.message: a new node created by the document

path_algorithm_tooltip.message: The custom internal algorithm tries to create descriptive paths for multiple pages, whereas Chromium's algorithm aims for shorter paths

path_quote_tooltip.message: Element attributes like id and class can have their values be wrapped in single or double quotes (for example, 'id' or "id")

path_optimized_tooltip.message: Paths can be optimized (short) or unoptimized (up to the root node)

path_js_tooltip.message: Generate paths with JavaScript functions document.querySelector (Selector) or document.evaluate (XPath)

property_helper_text.message: Examples: outerHTML, textContent, className, or title. Nested properties (separated by periods) can also be entered, so you can enter properties like dataset.src

saved_label.message: Saved. Click the Toolbar Icon again to finalize your settings

copied_label.message: Copied the data to your clipboard

picker_tips.message: Welcome to the Element Picker (EP). To start, click on an element on the page. If you need to traverse the DOM, you can click the four arrow buttons to move up, down, right, and left. When you're done, click the Check Button to save. Then click the toolbar icon again to see the path you saved and click ACCEPT to finalize your settings. To close the EP, click the X Button at any time. For tips and strategies on how to best use the EP, please view the

picker_tips_disclaimer.message: Note: The EP may not work on Complex Sites, Iframes, or Shadow Roots.

picker_tips_minimized.message: Welcome to the Element Picker (EP). To start, click on an element.

database_ap_icon_title.message: Click to view this AP Database URL

database_is_icon_title.message: Click to view this IS Database URL

database_blacklist_icon_title.message: This is a Blacklisted Database URL

database_whitelist_icon_title.message: This is a Whitelisted Database URL

popup_found_snackbar_label.message: Infy found a ?1 ?2 that matches this URL and configured it for you

save_dialog_description.message: Saving this URL will allow Infy to auto-activate the next time you visit using the settings you set here.

save_type_exact_tooltip.message: Save an Exact URL when using the Increment URL action and if you manually changed the default selection to increment or if you only wanted to match this exact (single) URL

save_type_pattern_tooltip.message: Saving a Pattern lets you match multiple URLs easily in two ways: 1) as a "Substring" of them or 2) as "Wildcards." For example, you could save a "Substring Pattern" like www.example.com/pictures/ to match all urls that have www.example.com/pictures/ in them as a substring. If you include at least one * character, your pattern will be treated as a "Wildcard." For example, you could save a "Wildcard Pattern" like *www.example.com/*/* to match both https://www.example.com/pictures/ and https://www.example.com/videos/

save_type_regex_tooltip.message: Save a Regular Expression for more fine-tuned matching via regex syntax. Important: When entering Regular Expressions, you must escape (prepend) the following special characters with a backslash character '\' if you want to match them literally: . ? \ ^ $ * + | ( ) [ ] { } Example: ^https?://www\.example\.com/.*

save_help_title.message: How To Save a URL Correctly:

save_help_content.message: In most cases, you can pick Pattern and shorten the URL so that it matches multiple URLs that are similar. (If you know regex syntax, you can select Regular Expression instead.) Select Exact if using the Increment URL action and if you manually changed the selection or if you wanted Infy to only activate on this exact (single) URL.

save_example_content.message: If you wanted Infy to activate on all google search pages (no matter what your search term is), then select the Pattern option and shorten the URL to only contain the common characters that are in all google search URLs e.g. https://www.google.com/search (trimming off all the characters that appear after "search")

save_dialog_notice.message: Click YES and ACCEPT to finalize saving the URL or click NO and ACCEPT to delete it

shuffle_dialog_description.message: You can have the next URLs be shuffled in a random order. Set the Shuffle Amount to set the number of URLs to shuffle.

shuffle_dialog_notice.message: Click YES to enable shuffling or click NO to disable shuffling

shuffle_amount_tooltip.message: This affects the range of URLs that you will see when you have shuffle enabled. For example, a value of 100 would mean that if you start at page=1 with an interval of 1, the next URLs you will see will only be in the range of 2-101. Increase or decrease the amount to adjust the range.

scripts_dialog_description.message: Infy can execute additional scripts to help improve compatibility. You normally don't need to use these settings, but they may help on some websites.

scripts_dialog_notice.message: Important: Some settings will only apply after saving this URL and refreshing the page

lazy_load_source_tooltip.message: This is the attribute that has the image's URL. It's typically 'data-src' or a 'data-*' attribute. You can inspect using your browser's DevTools to see which one it is.

lazy_load_destination_tooltip.message: This is the attribute of the element that you want to set. For images and other media, this is almost always 'src'. Need to set the background-image instead? Simply enter 'style.background-image' (without the quotation marks) and Infy will know what to do.

mirror_page_tooltip.message: Makes the AJAX Iframe load as a mirror of this page, allowing it to start on the same page you're currently viewing. Only enable this setting if the site doesn't update your address bar as you navigate; that is, it is a pure SPA or it uses POST method forms.

mirror_page_mode_import_tooltip.message: Clones the page's nodes and transfers them to the iframe. This is the less destructive option.

mirror_page_mode_adopt_tooltip.message: Transfers the actual page's nodes to the iframe, including any event listeners attached to the nodes.

spa_label.message: Watch for changes on the page to help enable late activation (AJAX/SPA)

spa_tooltip.message: This setting is designed to handle AJAX websites and SPAs (Single-page Applications). When visiting this website, Infy will use a MutationObserver to watch for changes on the page. This may help enable late auto-activation if the updated page content matches a Saved URL. (Experimental)

help_dialog_description.message: Need help or more information? Or is something not working right? You can view the Help Guide or Report a Problem to get personal assistance.

help_dialog_notice.message: Important: If you are reporting an issue, you can click the Copy Debug Data Button to copy your current settings to your clipboard and paste them into the debug field of the report. The data includes information about the current URL you are on, but does not include your saves. Only post your settings if you are comfortable sharing them or if requested.

next_prev_url_not_right.message: Not quite right? Try adjusting the path or keywords (in Options) or switch to another action

next_keywords_enabled_label.message: Look for links using Keywords if the Path fails

prev_keywords_enabled_label.message: Look for links using Keywords if the Path fails

property_tooltip.message: This is the DOM property of the element. For links, this is almost always going to just be "href". This input is rarely ever needed. However, you can also enter nested properties (separated by periods). For example, to access data-* attributes like data-src, you can enter the property as dataset.src

increment_header_text.message: Select the part of the URL to Increment or

decrement_tooltip.message: To decrement, enter a negative interval like -1

error_skip_tooltip.message: This checks if the next URL will return an HTTP error code (like 404) and increments again, skipping it up to 100 times until it finds the next good URL. Note that some websites may choose to not return an error code. You may notice a few seconds delay when error skipping. Set to 0 to disable it.

base_date_tooltip.message: See Help Guide for Date Formats

base_custom_tooltip.message: See Help Guide for Custom Bases

multi_button_tooltip.message: Multi Incrementing - Click to increment up to 3 parts of the URL simultaneously or in ranges. See the Help Guide for more information.

button_details.message: This action is designed to handle complex AJAX and SPA websites in two ways. Infy can click a "Load More" button as you scroll down the page and perform no appending, letting the website append the content. Or you can use Infy's special — but highly experimental — AJAX append mode to click the "Next" button and append the next page's elements.

list_text_field_helper_line.message: URLs must be separated by line breaks, have the same domain, and start with a protocol

list_description.message: Infy can append pages based on your list of URLs. Just make sure that all URLs begin with a protocol like https:// and that they belong to the same domain of the page you're on:

list_domain_tooltip.message: This is the domain/origin of the page you are currently on. Please make sure that all URLs belong to this domain. Infy can't append pages from other domains due to the CORS Policy enforced by your browser

page_description.message: This append mode is for simple sites. It appends the full page as is, but may break HTML or images. This is the simplest append mode and requires no configuration from your side.

iframe_description.message: This append mode is for complex sites. It appends the full page in an iframe so HTML or images won't break. Try using this append mode if the Page append mode isn't working.

element_description.message: This append mode is similar to what AutoPagerize uses. Unlike the Page and Iframe modes which append the full page, it appends only specific elements on the page for seamless scrolling. You can provide the Page Element Path to select the specific elements on the page to append. For example, if the elements are images inside a div with the id "my-div", your Page Element Path could be a Selector like "#my-div img" or an XPath like "//div[@id='my-div']//img"

media_description.message: Appends media elements like images. You must already be viewing the first media element, as it is for sequential URLs that point directly to media files (like "001.jpg").

none_description.message: This append mode is for actions that don't require Infy to append anything, like Click Button, as it's expected that the website will append the content itself. Try using this append mode if you see a "Load More" button on the page.

ajax_description.message: This append mode is an advanced version of the Element append mode, but is intended for AJAX and SPA sites that don't use links. Thus, it is only compatible with the Click Button action. You must provide a Page Element Path to select the elements on the page that should be appended. The Load Element Path (Iframe) and Remove Element Path (Native) are optional. See the Help Guide for more information.

iframe_page_one_label.message: Load Page 1 in an iframe for maximum unbreakability

page_element_iframe_tooltip.message: Enabling this is like having a hybrid of both Element and Iframe modes. Try this mode if you notice that HTML or images are breaking while in regular Element mode. There are also two types of modes you can choose from: "Import" or "Trim."

page_element_iframe_mode_import_tooltip.message: Imports the elements from the iframe to the page.

page_element_iframe_mode_trim_tooltip.message: Appends a trimmed down iframe that only contains the elements. To avoid bad formatting, you may need to remove the last segment > (Selector) or / (XPath) from the Page Element Path.

insert_before_path_tooltip.message: This path is optional and rarely used. It lets you adjust the insertion point of the page element to come before footers or paginated dividers to help keep them out of view.

ajax_mode_native_tooltip.message: A unique mode that tries to disable the page from removing elements and scrolling you back to the top after the button is clicked. Important: This mode is still in the proof of concept stage and will be redesigned in the future with breaking changes. It has hidden fields not exposed in the UI and is only intended to be used by experienced users who desire a native AJAX experience.

ajax_mode_iframe_tooltip.message: Creates a hidden iframe that clicks the button and imports elements to the page.

remove_element_path_tooltip.message: (Optional) This path selects elements that need to be removed. For example, after the button is clicked, some websites might append empty or placeholder "ghost" nodes that should be removed.

load_element_path_tooltip.message: (Optional) This path selects elements that are still loading. For example, if you notice the elements appended haven't finished loading, you can enter a path that selects a loaded element (such as a placeholder image). This will delay the append until the path fails and no more loading elements are found.

auto_times_tooltip.message: The number of times to perform the action

auto_seconds_tooltip.message: The delay in seconds to wait before performing the action. If you are going to be appending a lot of pages, it's highly recommended to use a high seconds value in order to not overburden a website's server

auto_badge_tooltip.message: Shows the number of auto times left in the toolbar icon

auto_behavior_tooltip.message: Makes the slideshow scroll smoothly to the next page. Uncheck to make it scroll instantly

auto_slideshow_tooltip.message: Slideshow Mode will have Infy slide down to each page for you automatically and repeat

next_prev_result_message_success.message: A ? Link was found using the

next_prev_result_message_error.message: A ? Link wasn't found. Try another action or adjust the

next_prev_result_message_duplicate.message: A ? Link was found, but its page was already appended.

page_element_result_message_error.message: No elements were found. Try adjusting the

page_element_result_message_autodetect.message: ? element(s) were auto detected using the

page_element_result_tooltip_success.message: The parent element's tag is ?1 and the insertion point is going to be ?2

button_result_message_success.message: The button was found using the

button_result_message_error.message: The button wasn't found. Try adjusting the

button_result_tooltip_success.message: The button's tag name is ? and it is clickable

button_result_tooltip_error_clickable.message: The path returned an element, but it wasn't clickable

no_result_tooltip_error.message: The path looks to be valid but it didn't return anything. Please double-check the path in your browser's console and try it again

duplicate_result_tooltip_error.message: The path looks to be valid but it returned a previously appended URL, which would produce cyclic pages. If you are changing the link type between Next and Prev, you can save this URL and refresh the page to continue.

jspath_result_tooltip_error.message: Error evaluating this JS Path. Note that JS Paths must be formatted as chained context selectors and must start with document.querySelector(). See the Help Guide for more details. Error:

next_prev_empty_error.message: A Next Link or Prev Link is required in order to continue; please adjust the path or switch to another action

selection_notalphanumeric_error.message: Select only alphanumeric characters or adjust the base type to match the selection

selection_notinurl_error.message: Selection has to be a part of the URL

selection_toolarge_error.message: Selection is too large; please select a smaller number or fewer characters

selection_base_error.message: Select only numbers or a higher base type to match characters in selection

selectionstart_invalid_error.message: Selection position must be from URL

interval_invalid_error.message: Interval has to be between -9007199254740991 and 9007199254740991

error_skip_invalid_error.message: Error Skip has to be between 0 and 100

base_date_invalid_error.message: Date format doesn't match selection. Try viewing the help guide for examples

base_roman_invalid_error.message: A roman numeral couldn't be parsed from the selection (Latin is for upper and lower case; U216 and U217 are unicode)

base_decimal_invalid_error.message: A decimal number (in the format of #.# like "1.5") could not be parsed from the selection

base_custom_invalid_error.message: Custom base couldn't be validated against selection. There may be characters in your selection that aren't in the custom base's alphabet. Try viewing the help guide for examples

multi_count_error.message: To multi-increment, select at least two selections in the URL

shuffle_amount_error.message: If Shuffle is enabled, the Shuffle Amount needs to be between 1 and 10000

button_position_error.message: Button Position should be between 0 and 10000 Pixels

button_auto_slideshow_error.message: Can't use the Auto Slideshow mode with the Click Button action

list_empty_error.message: Your URL List can't be empty

append_media_action_error.message: The Media append mode requires a sequence of URLs and can only be used with the Increment URL or URL List actions. Try changing to the appropriate action

append_none_action_error.message: To use the None append mode, please select the Click Button action

append_ajax_action_error.message: To use the AJAX append mode, please select the Click Button action

append_click_action_error.message: To use the Click Button action, please select the Element, None, or AJAX append modes

append_click_element_iframe_error.message: To use the Click Button action with the Element append mode, please uncheck Element Iframe Mode.

auto_times_invalid_error.message: Auto Times has to be between 1 and 1000

auto_seconds_invalid_error.message: Auto Seconds has to be between 1 and 3600

save_url_error.message: In order to save a URL, please enter a URL to save or un-toggle the Heart Button

save_type_error.message: In order to save a URL, please select a save type (like Pattern) or un-toggle the Heart Button

save_multi_error.message: Can't Save a URL if Multi-Incrementing is enabled due to complexity; please un-toggle either the Save Heart or Multi-Incrementing Buttons

local_url_append_error.message: This looks like a Local file:// URL and Infy can't use the Append Mode you selected due to CORS. Please change it to Media or None (Button)

popup_error_message.message: Oops — Sorry! Infy had trouble loading on this page. Infy might not have permission to work on this page (for example: Browser Pages, Options Page, or New Tab Page), or you might need to try refreshing this page again. If that doesn't work, you might need to try resetting your Options (About section).

popup_error_reason_chrome.message: Chrome is undefined! This indicates a severe error as chrome is the base object in the Extension API.

popup_error_reason_tabs.message: Couldn't query for this tab! Please try refreshing this tab again. If it still doesn't work, please try a different website or URL.

popup_error_reason_items.message: Your storage items may be corrupted or missing! This indicates a severe error with your Options as the extension can't work without any settings. Please try resetting your Options (About section).

popup_error_reason_instance.message: The content script couldn't load. This usually means you just need to wait a few more seconds for this page to finish loading or you may need to refresh this page again. You might also want to check your Browser's Extension Settings Page and ensure the extension has its "Site Access" set to "On all sites." If it's still not working, you might have another extension that is interfering with it or you might need to reinstall it.

popup_error_help.message: Help is right around the corner! Click Help to get personal assistance.

stats_dialog_description.message: You can enable stats to see how many pages Infy appended and other cool statistics. This feature is inspired by uBO's "Blocked since install" stat and is completely optional. Your stats, just like all your other data, are only stored locally on your device and only you have access to them.

stats_snackbar_enable_label.message: Stats are now enabled. Check back later to see some numbers.

ui_settings_description.message: Jazz it up and change the look and feel of the UI.

state_tooltip.message: This is Infy's current global on/off state. When it is off, it will not auto-activate on Saved URLs or Database URLs. This setting automatically adjusts each time you either click the "ACCEPT" or the "Power On/Off" Buttons in Infy's UI Window to turn it on or off. This setting is only provided in the Options in the extremely unlikely event that you need to control it here instead.

button_size_tooltip.message: This is the button you'll click on in Infy's UI whenever you want to manually go down a page

tooltips_enable_checkbox_label.message: Enable common tooltips in the UI Window

extra_inputs_tooltip.message: Enabling this setting will show the uncommonly used inputs, "Next Link Property" and "Insert Before Path," in the UI Window. These inputs take up valuable space in the UI and are rarely (if ever) needed, so it's not recommended to enable this setting unless you are sure you need them. Important: These inputs may be deprecated and removed from the UI in the future.

extra_inputs_checkbox_label.message: Show extra inputs in the UI Window

version_theme_checkbox_label.message: Show the Version 0.8 Eightfinity theme in the UI Window

preferred_path_type_tooltip.message: CSS Selectors and XPath expressions are both supported for all path inputs. This setting is only used as a tie-breaker in the extremely rare situation that a path you enter validates as both a Selector and XPath.

saves_settings_description.message: Save your own sites — each with their own custom infinite scroll settings — and have Infy auto-activate the next time you visit them. You can save URLs by clicking the Heart Button in the top-right corner of Infy's UI Window. If you're an experienced user, you can also add saves using the Add Save button below and manually entering in its properties. To keep your data as private as possible, Infy only saves URLs locally onto your device — not in the cloud.

saves_none.message: ... Aw! You don't have any Saves yet.

saves_manage.message: Click on the Saves to view and edit them. To delete them, check the checkbox and click the delete button below the table.

saves_add_tooltip.message: This lets you add a save using a template. By default, the template is minimal and uses the "next" action and "page" append mode, with the URL being the only item you need to modify. However, if you check any existing save before clicking this button, that save will be used as a template for your new save with all its keys and values already entered for you. Tip: You can override the default "savesTemplate" object via the "Manual Backup/Restore" feature. You can also create a separate "template save" just for the purpose of adding new saves later.

saves_template_corrupted.message: Your savesTemplate object is corrupted; to fix this, you can reset your options or edit the savesTemplate object using the Manual Backup/Restore feature.

save_dialog_helper_text.message: Click on the text to edit the save

save_dialog_delete_text.message: Are you sure you want to delete the selected saves?

saves_snackbar_error_view_label.message: Oops! There was an error opening the save (it may not be valid JSON).

saves_snackbar_error_edit_label.message: Oops! There was an error editing the save.

saves_snackbar_error_url_label.message: Please enter a "url" for the save

saves_snackbar_select_delete_error_label.message: Please select at least one save to delete by checking one of the checkboxes

database_whitelist_blacklist_text_field_.message: Please separate URLs by line breaks. If using Regular Expressions, surround them with / characters. If entering Exact URLs, surround them with " characters. If matching specific Database URLs, surround them with ( ) characters. Everything else is treated as a Pattern (that is, either a Substring or a Wildcard with * characters). See the Help Guide for more information. Examples:

database_settings_description.message: Infy can use Databases to setup infinite scrolling for thousands of websites for you automagically. You can either have Infy auto-activate on Database URLs by default (Blacklist Mode) or not auto-activate by default (Whitelist Mode). This is controlled by the "Activation Mode" setting below.

database_contribute.message: Note: The Databases are hosted on Wedata.net and are curated by users just like you! Please consider contributing to them and give back to the community so we all can benefit from one another.

database_contribute_link.message: Learn how to contribute to the Databases.

database_disclaimer.message: Important: If you have an AutoPagerize extension installed, please make sure to delete the AP Database so that Infy doesn't activate itself along with AP. You can still use the AutoPagerize extension for AP Database URLs and use Infy for other URLs.

database_update_tooltip.message: This setting will keep your copy of the databases auto-updated and keep websites' infinite scroll settings up to date. Infy will check and re-download the databases if it has been more than the number of days since the last download. It's recommended to set this to 1 or 2 Days as websites can change their design at any time. Set to 0 to disable auto-updating.

database_location_tooltip.message: This is your preferred location to download the databases from. The databases are originally hosted on wedata.net, but it's recommended to use a CDN like jsdelivr.net or statically.io. They will download faster, be securely served over https, and help relieve wedata.net's bandwidth cost. Note: The github.io mirror should only be used for testing purposes.

database_mode_tooltip.message: You can either have Infy auto-activate on all Database URLs by default, but specify a list of URLs to not activate on (Blacklist Mode) or not auto-activate by default but specify a list of URLs to activate on (Whitelist mode).

database_mode_blacklist_label.message: Blacklist Mode (Activate on Database URLs by default)

database_mode_whitelist_label.message: Whitelist Mode (Don't activate on Database URLs by default)

database_dialog_items_helper_text.message: Database items are sorted by newest updates

database_dialog_stats_helper_text.message: Database stats are sorted by number of items

database_snackbar_download_error_label.message: Oops! Could not download the database(s)

database_snackbar_select_error.message: Please select at least one database by checking one of the checkboxes

database_empty_error.message: Database downloaded but is empty (length is 0)!

shortcuts_description.message: Pfft... just scrolling? Infy supports shortcuts too! There's shortcuts for the following actions: Down one page, Up one page, Turn on or off, Blacklist or whitelist a URL, and Pause or resume Auto. When you press the Down shortcut command, if it hasn't been activated yet, Infy will conveniently turn on and auto-activate itself using the default infinite scroll (action and append) settings: next page.

shortcuts_dialog_description.message: To configure your browser's extension shortcuts:

shortcuts_dialog_disclaimer.message: Important: Your browser may change these steps in the future

scroll_settings_description.message: These settings affect how Infy works behind the scenes while you scroll and pages are being appended. Some of these settings are a little technical, so if you make a mistake, you can click the Reset Options button in the About section to return to the default values.

scroll_detection_tooltip.message: This is the API Infy uses to detect your current scroll position on the page. Intersection Observer is a newer API that will use less CPU, but may be less accurate in determining when a page should be appended. Scroll Listener uses more CPU, but is more accurate and is carefully throttled to not use too much CPU. If you encounter issues with Infy not appending pages when expected, try switching to Scroll Listener.

scroll_behavior_tooltip.message: Whenever you tell Infy to scroll to a page by pressing a button or by entering a shortcut, it can either scroll to the page instantly or smoothly. (This has no effect on how you scroll.)

scroll_update_tooltip.message: As you scroll, Infy can update the address bar and tab title to reflect the actual URL and title of the current page you are viewing. It's important to note that updating the address bar will add the URL to your browsing history (except when browsing in Incognito/Private Mode), and you may wish to disable this if you want to keep your history minimal. Note that the address bar can't be updated when viewing local files.

scroll_append_threshold_tooltip.message: This affects how soon in advance Infy should start requesting a new page to append based on your scroll position. For example, a value of 500 pixels means Infy won't start to append a new page until you've scrolled to within 500 pixels of the bottom. For most websites, you should keep this setting at around 500-1000 pixels for performance/efficiency reasons.

scroll_append_delay_tooltip.message: In order to not overburden a website's server, Infy adds a small delay after appending a page and before it is allowed to request the next page. A value of 2000 ms (2 seconds) is about right for most websites and is the lowest you should typically set this to. (In Auto mode, the Append Delay is replaced with the Auto Seconds set.)

scroll_maximum_pages_tooltip.message: Infy can limit the number of pages on the screen and in memory by attempting to remove older pages as you scroll down. Important: this feature is extremely experimental and may cause "scroll jumps" to occur on some websites due to the error-prone nature of manually re-adjusting your scroll position as pages are being removed. For this reason, it is strongly recommended to not enable this setting unless you absolutely need it for performance reasons (for example, on a mobile device). Note that this setting may be removed in the future and is not compatible with certain append modes, such as "None" and "AJAX."

scroll_maximum_pages_checkbox_label.message: Limit the maximum number of pages on the screen (Experimental)

scroll_divider_option_element.message: Only in Element and AJAX append modes

scroll_divider_buttons_checkbox_label.message: Show page navigation buttons inside the page divider

scroll_overlay_checkbox_label.message: Show an overlay with the current page number in the top right

scroll_icon_checkbox_label.message: Show an infinity icon inside the page divider and overlay

scroll_loading_checkbox_label.message: Show an infinity animation when Infy is loading at the bottom of the page

next_settings_description.message: This is a small glimpse into Infy's brains and is what allows it to find the next or prev link on most websites. Infy's algorithm first attempts to use the Path (Selector or XPath expression) and then falls back to parsing the entire page's links for common keywords. The default paths should work on many websites, but feel free to add in any extra next/prev keywords for your favorite sites. If you make a mistake, you can click the Reset Options button in the About section.

keywords_text_field_helper_line.message: Keywords are ordered in priority, separated by commas, all lowercase, and should not contain spaces, dashes, or underscores

increment_settings_description.message: Infy is powered by the URL Incrementer extension so you get the top-of-the-line incrementing experience! You can change the selection strategy used to pre-select which number to increment and adjust other settings.

selection_option_smart.message: Select numbers like "page=1" in the URL

selection_option_lastnumber.message: Select the last number in the URL

selection_option_firstnumber.message: Select the first number in the URL

selection_custom_url_label.message: Test URL String (Required, note this is saved)

selection_custom_help_label.message: For more testing and help, please use

selection_custom_matchgroup_error.message: Match found, but not in group entered

selection_custom_matchindex_error.message: Match found, but not in index entered

selection_custom_matchnotvalid_error.message: couldn't be validated against selection and current base (try adjusting index)

error_codes_tooltip.message: When incrementing URLs, you can enable error skipping by increasing the Error Skip value from 0. This setting lets you adjust which error codes should be skipped. By default, the 404 and 300 series redirect codes are pre-selected, but you have the option to change this here.

extra_settings_description.message: These are additional settings that don't quite fit in anywhere else.

custom_scripts_enable_label.message: Enable Infy's Custom Scripts (Tries to fix missing images for popular websites, like Google Search)

lazy_load_enable_label.message: Automatically try to fix lazily loaded images (Recommended)

resize_media_enable_label.message: Resize images and media that are bigger than the page (Recommended)

links_new_tab_enable_label.message: Open links in a new tab when clicking on them (Recommended)

links_new_tab_one_enable_label.message: Open Page 1's links in a new tab when clicking on them

custom_events_enable_label.message: Trigger custom events so that external custom scripts can be enabled (See Help Guide for details)

debug_enable_label.message: Enable Debug Mode (Shows an overlay with stats, icon feedback, and hidden iframes)

backup_settings_description.message: Backup and save your data to a text file. Or restore it through here. This lets you transfer your data to another device, or keep it for safe keeping on your disk drive.

backup_settings_disclaimer.message: Important: When backing up your data, your entire data, including saves and stats, will be backed up, but due to their size, the databases will not be backed up. When restoring your data, the restored data will overwrite your current data, including saves and stats.

backup_dialog_description.message: To manually backup your data, you can copy the text below. To manually restore your data, you can paste previously backed up text into the text input and click the Restore Data button.

backup_dialog_disclaimer.message: Important: Your data must be in JSON format and start with a "{" and end with a "}"

restore_snackbar_error_empty.message: Oops — your data can't be empty

restore_snackbar_error_json.message: Oops — your data isn't in valid JSON format

restore_snackbar_error_version.message: Oops — your data is missing the "version" property

reset_options_dialog_description.message: Are you sure you want to reset your options to the default values? (This will not reset your Saves, Databases, or Stats.)

thank_you_rainbow.message: Thank you so much for using Infy Scroll

thank_you_wish.message: I want you to be 100% happy with Infy, so please feel free to open an issue on GitHub if there are any problems. Infy loves scrolling with you and wishes you a Scrollful Day.

credits_you.message: ... and most of all you for using Infy
